title: On-loan Eddie Nketiah earns Leeds United vital draw as Preston dig in at Deepdale
text:
Preston North End 1 Leeds United 1

Eddie Nketiah surely will not have to wait much longer for his first league start in a Leeds United shirt; it is becoming increasingly difficult for Marcelo Bielsa to resist the clamour.

The forward’s lack of game time at Elland Road since his loan move from Arsenal has become a significant talking point among the club’s support, even if Unai Emery, his manager at Emirates Stadium, has said he is unconcerned.

Nketiah watched most of the action at Deepdale from the bench as Patrick Bamford – now eight games without a goal – failed to take any of the five chances that came his way.

By the time that Nketiah, fresh from scoring a hat-trick for England Under-21s, was introduced with 13 minutes left, Leeds trailed to a goal on the break from Tom Barkhuizen. But with the clock ticking down, Nketiah headed an equaliser to delight the 5,500 travelling fans.

The most that Bielsa was willing to concede afterwards was that Nketiah will get his chance at some point; his words seemed designed as much to protect the out-of-form Bamford as to calm any hype around the new arrival.
description: Eddie Nketiah surely will not have to wait much longer for his first league start in a Leeds United shirt;
